etymology.description: semantic: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + phonetic: 乞(乞) (qǐ, "beg") = action involving the mouth; suggestive of eating -> eat
etymology.interpretation: The character 吃(吃) (chī, "eat") combines the essential semantic element of a mouth, indicating oral activity, with a phonetic component suggesting the sound related to begging or requesting food, reinforcing the concept of eating.

examples.chinese: 他吃早餐(他吃早餐)，然后去上班(然後去上班)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chī zǎocān, ránhòu qù shàngbān.
examples.english: He eats breakfast, then goes to work.
